dialogue_turns.text: And the numbers back it up, too. I mean, he slashed his worst-case price target to just ten bucks a share. Ten dollars!

dialogue_turns.text: Which, if you look at Wednesday's trading, the stock plunged six percent. It's down forty-two percent this year, like, what's going on?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And the Q1 deliveries were really bad. He mentioned vehicle sales basically fell one-third sequentially from Q4 to Q1. If you annualize that, it's like two hundred fifty thousand units.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is way below their target of three-sixty to four hundred thousand. And for Q2, they're targeting ninety to a hundred thousand, but the whisper number is like, in the seventies.

And while Tesla has said its targeting sales of between 90,000 and 100,000 units in the second quarter, the whisper number seems to be in the in the 70,000s, maybe mid- to upper-70,000s, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And this all comes right after they just raised two point seven billion dollars this month in debt and equity. Curiously, Morgan Stanley was one of the banks involved.

dialogue_turns.text: That's the kicker, right? Jonas was like, "They missed an opportunity to raise money last year when things looked stronger." And now they're raising it near the lows.

dialogue_turns.text: Without any strategic partners, too. He was hoping for some board involvement, some know-how, not just institutional money.
